I'd start thinking about "co-morbidity's."   Topical corticosteroids and white spots/film on buccal mucosa make me think -- rule out Thrush (a fungal infection of the mouth.) TFT normal values are:"TSH" Test -- Thyroid Stimulating Hormone / Serum thyrotropin	0.4 to 6Under .4 can indicate possible hyperthyroidism. Over 6 is considered indicative of hypothyroidism. Note: the American Association of Clinical Endocrinologists has revised these guidelines as of early 2003, narrowing the range to .3 to 3.0. Many labs and practitioners are not, however, aware of these revised guidelines.Total T4 / Serum thyroxine	4.5 to 12.5	Less than 4.5 can be indicative of an underfunctioning thyroid when TSH is also elevated. Over 12.5 can indicate hyperthyroidism. Low T4 with low TSH can sometimes indicate a pituitary problem.Free T4 / Free Thyroxine - FT4	0.7 to 2.0	Less than 0.7 is considered indicative of possible hypothyroidism.T3 / Serum triiodothyronine	80 to 220	Less than 80 can indicate hypothyroidism.Your Endocrinologist may need to look at the slightly increased TSH.  Are you having any other signs or symptoms, like tanning or hyper-pigmentation on areas of your body not exposed to sunlight?  That might be related to an adrenal issue, and the adrenal glands control or effect many of the other hormones in the body, including TSH and Insulin.Bob

I'd also ask for Cortisol levels (ACTH stimulation test) to rule of Addison's Disease. "Tanning or hyper pigmentation "where the sun don't shine) breast, buttocks, etc is a diagnostic hallmark of Addison's.  Addison's disease effects every other hormone in the body.Bob

question: Hello everyone,Feedback please? Sorry for the long post :(I first noticed a white spot on the side of my tongue. Around that time I had been taking some antibiotics for a UTI. I was hardly ever sick only some sore throats when my BF wanted to sleep with the ceiling fan on high but they wouldn't last long. I was and still is a smoker (cigs)and I drank heavily, except during that time I had slowed down and was under a lot of stress with work, school, and family. At work I would lick my lips a lot and use chapstick. I would sometimes put my Topical corticosteroid on my lips (I've used it for many years because as a child I have always had a facial and scalp rash). A year later the white had spread to my cheeks (it looks like a white film) at that time I was under a lot of stress because my boyfriend and mother died in the same year and I began smoking and drinking heavily again. Around the time my mother passed I was at the hospital and went to use the bathroom (#2) and it was as if I was constipated and the toilet looked like a bowl of blood. That is the time when I noticed the constipation in my life (before if I had it I didn't notice because I was always drinking). After that I had a spell to come over me where I was on the verge of fainting, nausea, and diarrhea and that happened once again in 2008. In 2005 & 2006 I was having problems breathing and I stayed fatigue terribly. Went to the hospital (2006) and they ran tests (which ones not sure) they took an x-ray too and they came back and said everything was fine but just before I left they came in and said that they found a goiter. They referred me to a surgeon. So from the hospital to the surgeon to surgery. Never was I told anything or reason. Since then my hair had stopped falling out as bad but I was still gaining weight. Then once again (2008), my hair had gotten worse (brittle and falling out); the weight gain, high blood pressure, severe shoulder pains, legs and feet pains, and face and scalp rash. I have gone to the doctors and they say that my thyroid levels are normal. Could this be a thyroid problem or candida? Here are the results of my test back in March -Back around March of this year I decided to go and see the doctor that had removed a goiter in 2006. This past Feb. I had been feeling really crappy - tired a lot, weight slowly was increasing, constipated (sometimes it is so unbearable), and hair falling out terribly. Here are the labs:Comprehensive Metabolic PanelSodium 139Potassium 3.4 (low)Chloride 103Bicarbonate 26Anion Gap 13Glucose 114 (high)BUN 9Creatinine .79eGFR >60eGFR African American >60Calcium 8.9Albumin 4.3Total Protein 7.5Alk Phos 68Bilirubin Total .3AST (SGOT) 18ALT (SGPT) 19TSH with REFLEX FREE T4TSH 3.06Then while I was waiting to be seen by an endo, in which I went 9/2/2010 (yes, it took 3 months to get in). The results just came back last week and they are:Free T4 1.22TSH, high sensitivity 2.309I took a glimpse of my chart and right after my surgery my TSH was 2.0Now I was never put on meds and they say that I am fine. Can anyone shed some light. Could my untreated thyroid be the cause of the white film in my mouth? Also could it be causing my thyroid to fluctuate? I was also told back in 2007 that the cartilage was wearing thin in my knees and I retains a lot of fluid on them and sometimes my ankles and feet; my heart palps at times.
